EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



I. Statement of Policy

It is the policy of Gray & Company facility management to implement the requirements of the Risk Management Plan (RMP) by managing and operating the facility in accordance with appropriate regulations and general good operating practices. The objective is to minimize the risk of a fire or an accidental hazardous material release. Facility management has developed an Emergency Action Plan to ensure a fast and efficient response in the event of an accidental hazardous material release, fire or other emergency situation. Gray & Company personnel are expected to cooperate with fellow employees and other support personnel as directed by the emergency action management to assure successful resolution of any emergency.



II. Source Description and Regulated Substances

The Gray & Company processing facility is located at 3325 W. Polk Road in the county of Oceana.  The Gray & Company Sulfur Dioxide process was installed in June of 2014 at the 5359 W Fox Road in Mears, MI address.  The regulated stationary source is Sulfur Dioxide CAS #7664-09-5 and the maximum intended quantity is approximately 40,000 lbs.



III. Worst Case and Alternative Case Release Scenarios

Worst case and alternative case release scenarios have been prepared.  Please see onsite personnel for these documents.



IV. Prevention Programs

The Gray & Company facility has in place and is in compliance with the OSHA PSM rule for the sulfur dioxide storage and use. This prevention program contains all chemical specific prevention steps for our accidental release prevention program.



V. 5-year Accident History

This facility has experienced NO accidental releases from the covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



VI. Emergency Response Program



This facility has an Emergency Action Plan that has b

een given to the Oceana County LEPC for use in community emergency coordination planning. Periodic emergency action plan training will take place with plant personnel.



VII. Improved Safety

This facility has an excellent safety record. Our safety programs are under constant review by facility management. At least once a year the local responding Fire Department will be invited to the Gray & Company facility for the following:



? Become familiar with the operating practices.

? Become familiar with the Gray & Company facility, both outside and inside. This will be accomplished by a guided tour.

? Be given a review of the Emergency Action Plan, and how Gray & Company would see the Fire Department assisting in an emergency.

? Give a tour of the sulfur dioxide storage and use system.



In addition, each of the items identified in the process hazard analysis will be used to improve the safety at Gray & Company.
